channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Spurs open talks to sign Liverpool's Robertson
item.description: Tottenham enter into talks with Liverpool as they look to secure a deal for left-back Andy Robertson.

item.title: 'A big blow' - Grealish has stress fracture
item.description: There is no timescale on on-loan Everton winger Jack Grealish's recovery from a stress fracture in his foot, says manager David Moyes.

item.title: Rodman 'becomes highest-paid women's footballer'
item.description: Trinity Rodman signs a new three-year deal with Washington Spirit that will reportedly make her the world's highest-paid female footballer.

item.title: Wolves reject £33m Leeds bid for Strand Larsen
item.description: Leeds United fail with a bid to sign Wolves striker Jorgen Strand Larsen.

item.title: Arsenal's Nwaneri joins Marseille on loan
item.description: Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri joins French club Marseille on loan for the remainder of the season.

item.title: Cvancara 'ready to go' for Celtic with Kenny a doubt
item.description: Martin O'Neill hints Tomas Cvancara will make his Celtic debut in Sunday's vital Scottish Premiership visit to Tynecastle with fellow striker Johnny Kenny doubtful because of a calf strain.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v 'Roy Keane' - Saipan star Hardwicke
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on actor Éanna Hardwicke, who plays Roy Keane in the new film Saipan - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Who can discuss a free transfer in January?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when a player can sign a pre-contract agreement and which clubs are at risk of losing players.

item.title: 'He's my son' - Emery on pushing Tielemans
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery plays down a heated touchline incident with midfielder Youri Tielemans after substituting him against Fenerbahce.

item.title: Man Utd keen to resume Mainoo contract talks
item.description: Manchester United are keen to resume talks with midfielder Kobbie Mainoo over a new contract that would bring him in line with his fellow senior squad members.

item.title: How 'James Bond' might help Hearts overcome injury crisis
item.description: Are the Scottish Premiership leaders about to experience the true power of Jamestown Analytics in the midst of an injury crisis?

item.title: 'Genius' Emery helped me through 'tough period' - Rogers
item.description: Forward Morgan Rogers opens up on his relationship with "genius" Unai Emery and how the Aston Villa boss helped him through a tough start to this season.

item.title: Cuthbert on Chelsea, change & learning to be more 'direct'
item.description: Chelsea and Scotland forward Erin Cuthbert speaks to BBC Sport's Emma Sanders about the importance of being "direct", and recalls the time her mother educated her about how to use the tumble dryer.

item.title: Eat & Yap - Arsenal striker Smith answers quickfire questions
item.description: Arsenal striker and Women's Super League record signing Olivia Smith answers Alex Scott's quickfire questions in BBC Sport's new Eat & Yap series.

item.title: Defeat for 10-player Arsenal as Man Utd reach first League Cup final
item.description: Manchester United reach the Women's League Cup final for the first time with a narrow 1-0 victory against Arsenal, in a rain-drenched semi-final at Meadow Park.

item.title: Kaptein goal sends Chelsea into seventh straight League Cup final
item.description: Holders Chelsea reach a seventh successive final of the Women's League Cup with a narrow victory over rivals Manchester City at Joie Stadium.

item.title: 'Saipan was not a jolly' - the infamous Keane v McCarthy row
item.description: Former Republic of Ireland keeper Dean Kiely reveals what happened during Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy's infamous row before the 2002 World Cup.

item.title: Stories to follow as Pompey and Saints meet again
item.description: BBC Sport explores the main talking points going into the south coast derby as well as previewing what should be a special atmosphere on Sunday.

item.title: Celtic pick up where they left off under O'Neill - Trusty
item.description: Celtic defender Auston Trusty praises the impact of Martin O'Neill and his coaching staff after their 2-2 Europa League draw in Bologna.

item.title: Salah prime target for Saudi Pro League - Friday's gossip
item.description: Mohamed Salah and Vinicius Jr are prime targets for Saudi Pro League, Crystal Palace hold talks with Wolves over move for Jorgen Strand Larsen, Chelsea consider loan deal for Douglas Luiz, plus more.

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: FA Cup to get Champions League-style anthems
item.description: The Football Association commissions a Universal Music Group company to create anthems for both the men's and women's FA Cup tournaments.

item.title: When to reintroduce Fernandes? FPL talking point
item.description: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes has been in fine form since returning from injury, but when should he be reintroduced by FPL managers?

item.title: How 55 seconds left Forest's Europa League hopes in balance
item.description: Nottingham Forest's hopes of a top-eight finish in the Europa League - and a straight route to the last 16 - are hanging by a thread.

item.title: Five things in the EFL: Unwanted records and derby dates
item.description: West Bromwich Albion are on course for their worst away run for 135 years, while Portsmouth welcome Southampton for the south coast derby.

item.title: Captain Bannan set for Sheff Wed departure
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday captain Barry Bannan tells team-mates that Saturday's game at Bristol City will be his last for the club.

item.title: Cuthbert on 'tough love' and WSL title race
item.description: Chelsea's Erin Cuthbert and Alyssa Thompson discuss the WSL title race, learning "tough love" and adapting to a new club.

item.title: From write-off to right on track - what is next for Rohl's Rangers?
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland examines Rangers' turn in fortunes recently under Danny Rohl.

item.title: WSL to introduce academy contracts for next season
item.description: Academy contracts for young players at Women's Super League and WSL2 clubs will be introduced for the first time from the start of the 2026-27 season.

item.title: Aberdeen beat St Mirren to Olusanya loan from Houston
item.description: Former St Mirren forward Toyosi Olusanya hopes to "pick up where I left off" after signing for Scottish Premiership rivals Aberdeen on loan from Houston Dynamo.

item.title: Ipswich sign winger Mehmeti from Bristol City
item.description: Promotion-chasing Ipswich Town sign winger Anis Mehmeti from Bristol City for an undisclosed fee on a three-and-a-half-year contract.

item.title: Emery 'dreaming' of winning Europa League after writing off title
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery may not believe his team are Premier League title contenders - but he is "dreaming" of Europa League glory after reaching the last 16.

item.title: Who can join Aston Villa in Europa League last 16?
item.description: Aston Villa are through to the Europa League last 16 already - but with one round of matches to play in the league phase, only two of the other three British sides have a chance of joining them.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Infantino joke about British fans was 'cheap' - FSA
item.description: The Football Supporters' Association criticises Fifa president Gianni Infantino for making a "cheap" joke about British fans' behaviour at World Cups.

item.title: How will wind blow for Arbroath & Morton live on BBC TV?
item.description: Part-time Arbroath are defying odds again to challenge for promotion from the Scottish Championship and will provide a tough challenge for new Greenock Morton manager Ian Murray live on the BBC on Friday.

item.title: Midfielder Casemiro to leave Man Utd this summer
item.description: Manchester United say midfielder Casemiro will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of this season.

item.title: 'Ridiculous amount of games' - has Haaland played too much football?
item.description: Erling Haaland made a blistering start to the season but that prolific run of form has ground to a halt with only one goal in his past eight games.

item.title: Six English clubs and old foes - all to play for on Champions League final day
item.description: With the league phase of Champions League almost over, which teams can join Arsenal and Bayern Munich in the top eight?

item.title: Forest close in on Napoli striker Lucca
item.description: Nottingham Forest are closing in on the signing of Napoli striker Lorenzo Lucca.

item.title: Is holding Afcon every four years 'totally wrong' or 'good call'?
item.description: The announcement that the Africa Cup of Nations will be hosted every four years from 2028 sparked division, but what will it mean for the game on the continent?

item.title: Alex Scott meets Olivia Smith to Eat & Yap about Canada, Jamaica and more
item.description: In BBC Sport's new Eat & Yap series, Alex Scott meets some of the best WSL players to share the food they love and grew up eating, and talk about life on and off the pitch.

item.title: What to do with misfiring Haaland? FPL team of the week
item.description: FPL managers will be worried about Erling Haaland's recent form - is it time to move away from the Manchester City striker as a captain choice?

item.title: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
item.description: This is the story of how an unsigned contract that lay hidden in a bungalow for more than 50 years could have changed the course of English football.

item.title: Is a Panenka ever the right choice for a penalty?
item.description: Following Morocco's last-minute spot-kick miss in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sport asks if a Panenka is ever the right choice for a penalty.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Bayern's record-breaking Bundesliga season in numbers
item.description: BBC Sport examines the stunning numbers behind Bayern Munich's record-breaking start to the Bundesliga season - and what records they could topple.

item.title: Roma sign forward Malen from Aston Villa
item.description: Netherlands forward Donyell Malen joins Roma from Aston Villa after just one year with the Premier League side.

item.title: Tottenham sign Gallagher from Atletico for £35m
item.description: The former Chelsea midfielder joins Spurs on a deal until 2031.

item.title: Why Alonso's reign is over at Real Madrid
item.description: After Xabi Alonso's departure as Real Madrid manager, Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks into where it all went wrong.

item.title: Lehmann joins Leicester from FC Como
item.description: Leicester City have confirmed the signing of Switzerland forward Alisha Lehmann from FC Como this month.

item.title: Women's League Cup to undergo name and format changes
item.description: England's secondary cup competition will adopt a format like the Champions League from next season – and will "probably not" be called the League Cup.

item.title: Tottenham's Graham joins Ipswich Women squad revamp
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur forward Kit Graham joins Ipswich Town Women on loan for the rest of the season, their third signing of the week.

item.title: Everton's Gago 'free to go' if £500K fee offered
item.description: Everton forward Kelly Gago "is free to go" if another club offers the release clause fee in her contract, says manager Brian Sorensen.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
